title: Observing How the Universe Changed over Time

previous.title: Estimating the Size of the Observable Universe

next.title: The Large-Scale Structure of the Universe

content:
Rubin Observatory has discovered so many galaxies in the Universe that, if we were to display them all on a map of the sky, they could not be counted by eye. To work with very large numbers of galaxies, astronomers use concentration maps.

Concentration maps use colors to represent how many galaxies are in a particular area. They are like population density maps. Areas of high population density show many people living in a relatively small area. Look at this example.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Name a city in your country that has a high population density.
